title: 刘永胜课题组 | ACS ENERGY LETTERS-南大功能高分子材料教育部重点实验室
content: 刘永胜课题组 | ACS ENERGY LETTERS-南大功能高分子材料教育部重点实验室 首页实验室概况实验室简介组织结构学术委员会教授委员会新闻动态实验室新闻实验室动态行业动态研究团队人员概况师资队伍科研团队科技创新科研课题自主创新科研论文成果奖励近期发表论文学术交流交流与合作举办学术会议学术活动通知仪器平台实验室大型仪器学校仪器平台开放基金开放基金开放基金项目运行管理工作年报运行管理办法评估规则实验室规章制度文件下载  新闻动态科研课题自主创新科研论文成果奖励近期发表论文  近期发表论文当前位置：首页     > 科技创新     > 近期发表论文     >         正文刘永胜课题组 | ACS ENERGY LETTERS发布人：    发布时间：2024/12/30   浏览次数：  次Upgrading Spiro-OMeTAD with β-Chloroethylcarbazole to Improve the Stability of Perovskite Solar CellsByWang, JL (Wang, Jialin) [1] , [2] , [3] , [4] , [5] , [6] ; Lu, HZ (Lu, Haizhou) [6] , [10] ; Liu, YH (Liu, Yuhang) [6] ; Wang, PY (Wang, Pengyang) [1] , [2] , [3] , [4] , [5] ; Wang, SL (Wang, Sanlong) [1] , [2] , [3] , [4] , [5] ; Dong, XY (Dong, Xiyue) [3] , [7] , [8] , [9] ; Zhao, Y (Zhao, Ying) [1] , [2] , [3] , [4] , [5] ; Liu, YS (Liu, Yongsheng) [3] , [7] , [8] , [9] ; Grätzel, M (Gratzel, Michael) [1] , [6] ; Zhang, XD (Zhang, Xiaodan) [1] , [2] , [3] , [4] , [5]View Web of Science ResearcherID and ORCID (provided by Clarivate) SourceACS ENERGY LETTERS        arrow_drop_down       DOI10.1021/acsenergylett.4c02507Early AccessDEC 2024Indexed2024-12-19Document TypeArticle; Early AccessJump to    arrow_downward   Enriched Cited ReferencesAbstractSpiro-OMeTAD has served as a crucial hole transporting material (HTM) in the advancement of efficient perovskite solar cells (PSCs). However, the diminished thermal stability of lithium-doped Spiro-OMeTAD (Li-Spiro) has been a limiting factor, leading to a significant decline of the power conversion efficiency (PCE) and stability, particularly at a temperature exceeding 65 degrees C. Here, we report an upgraded HTM, Spiro-OMeCzCl, by incorporating chloroethyl-modified carbazole units to expand the conjugated area of the donor group. This novel configuration significantly enhances the thermal stability and film quality. The resulting PSCs utilizing Spiro-OMeCzCl achieved a high PCE of 24.6%, coupled with exceptional long-term stability. The target cells maintained approximately 95% of their initial PCE after 57 days under a nitrogen atmosphere. Importantly, in subsequent thermal stability tests involving a gradual temperature increase, the cells sustained an average PCE of over 85% after 200 h at temperatures ranging from 60 to 90 degrees C.上一篇：没有了下一篇：刘遵峰课题组 | SMALLCopyright 功能高分子材料教育部重点实验室  版权所有 天津市卫津路94号 　　　--相关链接--中华人民共和国教育部                    中华人民共和国科学技术部                    国家自然科学基金委员会                    ————————                    天津市科学技术委员会                    天津市自然科学基金                    ————————                    南开大学                    南开大学科学技术处                    南开大学化学学院                    刘永胜课题组 | ACS ENERGY LETTERS-南大功能高分子材料教育部重点实验室 首页实验室概况实验室简介组织结构学术委员会教授委员会新闻动态实验室新闻实验室动态行业动态研究团队人员概况师资队伍科研团队科技创新科研课题自主创新科研论文成果奖励近期发表论文学术交流交流与合作举办学术会议学术活动通知仪器平台实验室大型仪器学校仪器平台开放基金开放基金开放基金项目运行管理工作年报运行管理办法评估规则实验室规章制度文件下载  新闻动态科研课题自主创新科研论文成果奖励近期发表论文  近期发表论文当前位置：首页     > 科技创新     > 近期发表论文     >         正文刘永胜课题组 | ACS ENERGY LETTERS发布人：    发布时间：2024/12/30   浏览次数：  次Upgrading Spiro-OMeTAD with β-Chloroethylcarbazole to Improve the Stability of Perovskite Solar CellsByWang, JL (Wang, Jialin) [1] , [2] , [3] , [4] , [5] , [6] ; Lu, HZ (Lu, Haizhou) [6] , [10] ; Liu, YH (Liu, Yuhang) [6] ; Wang, PY (Wang, Pengyang) [1] , [2] , [3] , [4] , [5] ; Wang, SL (Wang, Sanlong) [1] , [2] , [3] , [4] , [5] ; Dong, XY (Dong, Xiyue) [3] , [7] , [8] , [9] ; Zhao, Y (Zhao, Ying) [1] , [2] , [3] , [4] , [5] ; Liu, YS (Liu, Yongsheng) [3] , [7] , [8] , [9] ; Grätzel, M (Gratzel, Michael) [1] , [6] ; Zhang, XD (Zhang, Xiaodan) [1] , [2] , [3] , [4] , [5]View Web of Science ResearcherID and ORCID (provided by Clarivate) SourceACS ENERGY LETTERS        arrow_drop_down       DOI10.1021/acsenergylett.4c02507Early AccessDEC 2024Indexed2024-12-19Document TypeArticle; Early AccessJump to    arrow_downward   Enriched Cited ReferencesAbstractSpiro-OMeTAD has served as a crucial hole transporting material (HTM) in the advancement of efficient perovskite solar cells (PSCs). However, the diminished thermal stability of lithium-doped Spiro-OMeTAD (Li-Spiro) has been a limiting factor, leading to a significant decline of the power conversion efficiency (PCE) and stability, particularly at a temperature exceeding 65 degrees C. Here, we report an upgraded HTM, Spiro-OMeCzCl, by incorporating chloroethyl-modified carbazole units to expand the conjugated area of the donor group. This novel configuration significantly enhances the thermal stability and film quality. The resulting PSCs utilizing Spiro-OMeCzCl achieved a high PCE of 24.6%, coupled with exceptional long-term stability. The target cells maintained approximately 95% of their initial PCE after 57 days under a nitrogen atmosphere. Importantly, in subsequent thermal stability tests involving a gradual temperature increase, the cells sustained an average PCE of over 85% after 200 h at temperatures ranging from 60 to 90 degrees C.上一篇：没有了下一篇：刘遵峰课题组 | SMALLCopyright 功能高分子材料教育部重点实验室  版权所有 天津市卫津路94号 　　　--相关链接--中华人民共和国教育部                    中华人民共和国科学技术部                    国家自然科学基金委员会                    ————————                    天津市科学技术委员会                    天津市自然科学基金                    ————————                    南开大学                    南开大学科学技术处                    南开大学化学学院                     首页实验室概况实验室简介组织结构学术委员会教授委员会新闻动态实验室新闻实验室动态行业动态研究团队人员概况师资队伍科研团队科技创新科研课题自主创新科研论文成果奖励近期发表论文学术交流交流与合作举办学术会议学术活动通知仪器平台实验室大型仪器学校仪器平台开放基金开放基金开放基金项目运行管理工作年报运行管理办法评估规则实验室规章制度文件下载  新闻动态科研课题自主创新科研论文成果奖励近期发表论文  近期发表论文当前位置：首页     > 科技创新     > 近期发表论文     >         正文刘永胜课题组 | ACS ENERGY LETTERS发布人：    发布时间：2024/12/30   浏览次数：  次Upgrading Spiro-OMeTAD with β-Chloroethylcarbazole to Improve the Stability of Perovskite Solar CellsByWang, JL (Wang, Jialin) [1] , [2] , [3] , [4] , [5] , [6] ; Lu, HZ (Lu, Haizhou) [6] , [10] ; Liu, YH (Liu, Yuhang) [6] ; Wang, PY (Wang, Pengyang) [1] , [2] , [3] , [4] , [5] ; Wang, SL (Wang, Sanlong) [1] , [2] , [3] , [4] , [5] ; Dong, XY (Dong, Xiyue) [3] , [7] , [8] , [9] ; Zhao, Y (Zhao, Ying) [1] , [2] , [3] , [4] , [5] ; Liu, YS (Liu, Yongsheng) [3] , [7] , [8] , [9] ; Grätzel, M (Gratzel, Michael) [1] , [6] ; Zhang, XD (Zhang, Xiaodan) [1] , [2] , [3] , [4] , [5]View Web of Science ResearcherID and ORCID (provided by Clarivate) SourceACS ENERGY LETTERS        arrow_drop_down       DOI10.1021/acsenergylett.4c02507Early AccessDEC 2024Indexed2024-12-19Document TypeArticle; Early AccessJump to    arrow_downward   Enriched Cited ReferencesAbstractSpiro-OMeTAD has served as a crucial hole transporting material (HTM) in the advancement of efficient perovskite solar cells (PSCs). However, the diminished thermal stability of lithium-doped Spiro-OMeTAD (Li-Spiro) has been a limiting factor, leading to a significant decline of the power conversion efficiency (PCE) and stability, particularly at a temperature exceeding 65 degrees C. Here, we report an upgraded HTM, Spiro-OMeCzCl, by incorporating chloroethyl-modified carbazole units to expand the conjugated area of the donor group. This novel configuration significantly enhances the thermal stability and film quality. The resulting PSCs utilizing Spiro-OMeCzCl achieved a high PCE of 24.6%, coupled with exceptional long-term stability. The target cells maintained approximately 95% of their initial PCE after 57 days under a nitrogen atmosphere. Importantly, in subsequent thermal stability tests involving a gradual temperature increase, the cells sustained an average PCE of over 85% after 200 h at temperatures ranging from 60 to 90 degrees C.上一篇：没有了下一篇：刘遵峰课题组 | SMALL  新闻动态科研课题自主创新科研论文成果奖励近期发表论文  近期发表论文当前位置：首页     > 科技创新     > 近期发表论文     >         正文刘永胜课题组 | ACS ENERGY LETTERS发布人：    发布时间：2024/12/30   浏览次数：  次Upgrading Spiro-OMeTAD with β-Chloroethylcarbazole to Improve the Stability of Perovskite Solar CellsByWang, JL (Wang, Jialin) [1] , [2] , [3] , [4] , [5] , [6] ; Lu, HZ (Lu, Haizhou) [6] , [10] ; Liu, YH (Liu, Yuhang) [6] ; Wang, PY (Wang, Pengyang) [1] , [2] , [3] , [4] , [5] ; Wang, SL (Wang, Sanlong) [1] , [2] , [3] , [4] , [5] ; Dong, XY (Dong, Xiyue) [3] , [7] , [8] , [9] ; Zhao, Y (Zhao, Ying) [1] , [2] , [3] , [4] , [5] ; Liu, YS (Liu, Yongsheng) [3] , [7] , [8] , [9] ; Grätzel, M (Gratzel, Michael) [1] , [6] ; Zhang, XD (Zhang, Xiaodan) [1] , [2] , [3] , [4] , [5]View Web of Science ResearcherID and ORCID (provided by Clarivate) SourceACS ENERGY LETTERS        arrow_drop_down       DOI10.1021/acsenergylett.4c02507Early AccessDEC 2024Indexed2024-12-19Document TypeArticle; Early AccessJump to    arrow_downward   Enriched Cited ReferencesAbstractSpiro-OMeTAD has served as a crucial hole transporting material (HTM) in the advancement of efficient perovskite solar cells (PSCs). However, the diminished thermal stability of lithium-doped Spiro-OMeTAD (Li-Spiro) has been a limiting factor, leading to a significant decline of the power conversion efficiency (PCE) and stability, particularly at a temperature exceeding 65 degrees C. Here, we report an upgraded HTM, Spiro-OMeCzCl, by incorporating chloroethyl-modified carbazole units to expand the conjugated area of the donor group. This novel configuration significantly enhances the thermal stability and film quality. The resulting PSCs utilizing Spiro-OMeCzCl achieved a high PCE of 24.6%, coupled with exceptional long-term stability. The target cells maintained approximately 95% of their initial PCE after 57 days under a nitrogen atmosphere. Importantly, in subsequent thermal stability tests involving a gradual temperature increase, the cells sustained an average PCE of over 85% after 200 h at temperatures ranging from 60 to 90 degrees C.上一篇：没有了下一篇：刘遵峰课题组 | SMALL刘永胜课题组 | ACS ENERGY LETTERS发布人：    发布时间：2024/12/30   浏览次数：  次Upgrading Spiro-OMeTAD with β-Chloroethylcarbazole to Improve the Stability of Perovskite Solar CellsByWang, JL (Wang, Jialin) [1] , [2] , [3] , [4] , [5] , [6] ; Lu, HZ (Lu, Haizhou) [6] , [10] ; Liu, YH (Liu, Yuhang) [6] ; Wang, PY (Wang, Pengyang) [1] , [2] , [3] , [4] , [5] ; Wang, SL (Wang, Sanlong) [1] , [2] , [3] , [4] , [5] ; Dong, XY (Dong, Xiyue) [3] , [7] , [8] , [9] ; Zhao, Y (Zhao, Ying) [1] , [2] , [3] , [4] , [5] ; Liu, YS (Liu, Yongsheng) [3] , [7] , [8] , [9] ; Grätzel, M (Gratzel, Michael) [1] , [6] ; Zhang, XD (Zhang, Xiaodan) [1] , [2] , [3] , [4] , [5]View Web of Science ResearcherID and ORCID (provided by Clarivate) SourceACS ENERGY LETTERS        arrow_drop_down       DOI10.1021/acsenergylett.4c02507Early AccessDEC 2024Indexed2024-12-19Document TypeArticle; Early AccessJump to    arrow_downward   Enriched Cited ReferencesAbstractSpiro-OMeTAD has served as a crucial hole transporting material (HTM) in the advancement of efficient perovskite solar cells (PSCs). However, the diminished thermal stability of lithium-doped Spiro-OMeTAD (Li-Spiro) has been a limiting factor, leading to a significant decline of the power conversion efficiency (PCE) and stability, particularly at a temperature exceeding 65 degrees C. Here, we report an upgraded HTM, Spiro-OMeCzCl, by incorporating chloroethyl-modified carbazole units to expand the conjugated area of the donor group. This novel configuration significantly enhances the thermal stability and film quality. The resulting PSCs utilizing Spiro-OMeCzCl achieved a high PCE of 24.6%, coupled with exceptional long-term stability. The target cells maintained approximately 95% of their initial PCE after 57 days under a nitrogen atmosphere. This novel configuration significantly enhances the thermal stability and film quality. The resulting PSCs utilizing Spiro-OMeCzCl achieved a high PCE of 24.6%, coupled with exceptional long-term stability. The target cells maintained approximately 95% of their initial PCE after 57 days under a nitrogen atmosphere. Importantly, in subsequent thermal stability tests involving a gradual temperature increase, the cells sustained an average PCE of over 85% after 200 h at temperatures ranging from 60 to 90 degrees
